original_title: Think Again: Tips On Finding and Flexing Your Creativity
original_content:
Technical work  including problem-solving  is creative work. In addition, creativity is more than a vague and nebulous attribute that either is or isnt present when its needed. A short article by [Anthony D. Fredericks] gives some practical and useful tips on energizing and exercising ones creativity.
Why would creative thinking be meaningful to a technical person? The author shares an anonymous observation that as children were taught to stay inside the lines, while as adults we are often expected to think outside the box. Certainly when it comes to technical tasks, our focus is more on logical thinking. But problem solving benefits as much from creative thinking as it does from more logical approaches.
How can one cultivate creative thinking? The main idea is that creativity is best flexed and exercised by actively looking for connections and similarities between highly dissimilar elements, rather than focusing on their differences. Some thought exercises are provided to help with this process. Like with any exercise, the more one does it, the better one becomes.
Practicing more creative thinking can help jolt new ideas and approaches to a tough problem, so give it a shot. Its also worth keeping in mind that we all need a feeling of progress, especially during extended times of applying effort to something, so do yourself a favor and give yourself an occasional win.
title: 技術者のための創造性：問題解決とアイデア創出の重要性
body: 技術的な仕事は創造的な仕事であり、創造力は必要なときに存在するかどうかが曖昧な属性以上のものである。創造的な思考が技術的な人に意味を持つのはなぜか？ 創造的思考を養う方法や問題解決にどれだけ有益かが述べられている。試しに挑戦してみる価値がある。
titles: 技術者のための創造性：問題解決とアイデア創出の重要性
創造的思考の活性化：ヒントと実践的アプローチ
外部刺激を取り入れる：技術作業における創造力の役割
つながりと相違点：異なる要素間の関係性を探る創造的思考法
問題解決に役立つ：創造的思考の練習と有用なアプローチ
